titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 100: Statuta

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Codex 100: Statuta are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

notesStmt.note: Contains 17th-century note (f. 23r): Ex[aminatus]; x februarii 1634 pro Pasqualis q[uondam] Thome cons. Annibalim Christophori. Hyacintus Calamarius Sub.
Fragment of unidentified Italian document, 18th or 19th century, pasted on verso of front endleaf. A small fragment of another later Italian document is laid in the manuscript.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Statutes of Castello del Vivaro, in six books. The beginning of the manuscript is lacking, as is the beginning of the table of contents (previously before f. 60).

supportDesc.extent: 68 leaves : 219 x 157 (158 x 95) mm. bound to 224 x 160 mm. +

collation.p: Paper, iii (modern paper) + 67 + iii (modern paper); 1¹⁶(-1) 2¹⁶(-1) 3¹⁶(-1) 4¹⁴ 5¹²(-4, 10, 11, 12); 10-24, 26-70, [viii]; contemporary foliation in ink, upper right recto; [1-67]; modern foliation in pencil, lower right recto. According to the contemporary foliation, folios 1-9, 25, and 71 are missing; unnumbered stub with no loss of text between f. 38-39. Catchwords, lower right verso. References in this record are to the modern foliation.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a humanistic cursive script.

decoDesc.decoNote: Faint sketch of an infant in red, with caption HOC EST SA (f. 66r).

binding.p: Modern vellum with marbled endpapers. Paper is fragile; edges are tearing and fraying. Paper is badly stained and shows evidence of worm damage. Binding should be treated with care.

origin.p: Written in Italy in the late 16th century (Zacour-Hirsch). Castello del Vivaro mentioned on f. 4r; this might be the same as Castello in the vicinity of Florence.
